intro: Mirbelia oxylobioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mirbelia, is a small shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by narrow, elongated pods. Mirbelia oxylobioides is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, contributing to local biodiversity.
